title: Dwight Christmas
description: Dwight puts together a Pennsylvania Dutch-themed office Christmas party, but he ends it abruptly because Jim has to leave for his other job. Meanwhile, Erin seeks comfort from a co-worker after a disappointing text from Andy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Sighs] I'm having second thoughts about one of the shirts I packed. The blue one with the stripes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sure it's fine. it's a blue shirt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, yeah, but I'm wondering if it's too blue. Like, am I making a statement with the blueness?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am leaving early today for Philly, because tomorrow is the first day of my new job. So I figure I'd get in at 5:00, check into a hotel at about 6:00 so I can get a real good night of restless sleep and nervous puking.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, excuse me. Trying to get work done. Some people don't care about Jim's new sports job in Phila-Whatever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So you know my job has something to do with sports, but you don't know the end of the word "Philadelphia"?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Philadelphia. From the greek phila meaning "Love," and adelph, meaning "Adolf." "the city that loves Adolf." Good luck with your new enterprise and don't wear the blue striped shirt. It makes your neck look like an old mop handle.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam looks at Jim and nods her head in agreement]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh...Hey, guys, the Christmas party is today. Merry Christmas everyone!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Is It?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I mean, it says "X-Mas party," but I think we all know what that's code for.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So we're not going to have a Christmas party this year? Angela, how could you do this to us?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, right, like I'm responsible 'cause I'm in charge of the party planning committee.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, you are the one in charge of it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't blame me for something we all forgot.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, let's not blame her for something we all forgot.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I didn't realize how many of Angela's opinions I agreed with, until she tried to have my kneecap shattered for sleeping with her husband. She makes a lot of very sound points.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I knew the party was today, but nobody asked me to plan it, so I didn't. Hmm, funny how that works.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [Scoffs] We're out there sweating our balls off every day, bustin' our balls. We deserve a Christmas party!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, then, why don't we just get some liquor and those mini-Cupcakes?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Mini-Cupcakes? As in the mini version of regular cupcakes, which is already a mini version of cake? Honestly, where does it end with you people?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about an authentic Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas? Drink some gluhwein, enjoy some hasenpfeffer. Enjoy Christmas with saint Nicolas' rural German companion, Belsnickel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes! That, that, that! We're definitely doing that. Are we all in agreement?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Done, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No. I want Tropical Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Topless Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Tapas swiss miss.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Spanish tapas, and swiss miss hot cocoa-What's so hard to understand?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or, who was it that suggested the authentic Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas? I think it was someone really popular.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We already said no.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Too weird.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Holds up a picture] This is me and my family celebrating Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas in 1982 on the farm. There's me and my brother Jeb breaking the ceremonial pig rib. He doesn't come back for Christmas anymore. The sepia tint is from an app on my phone. This is the same photo, matrix style.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not understanding the confusion. Am I the only one who wants to try hufflepuffs and schnauzerhosen, and meet this glenpickle guy?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Blows a weak whistle] Party planning cimmittee, emgergency meeting. Now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: I'm just hoping German terrorists don't take over this Christmas party. Make me go all John McClane on their asses.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wait, German terrorists? That's oddly specific. And I think-I think you mean John McCain.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Die hard reference.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I haven't seen it.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: You haven't seen die hard?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Mm-Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Why haven't you seen die hard?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know, I just haven't.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Come on, you had to have at least seen some of it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: "now, i have a machine gun. Ho, ho, ho."

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: "Come out to the coast, we'll get together, have a few laughs."

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: None of this makes any sense to me!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, and when he takes the gun off his back, and he's like, "Yippie-Ki-Yay, mother-"

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Actually, he doesn't say that there. He says it earlier when he's on the radio with Hans.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes, you are right. Forgive me.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, that's okay, bud.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nope. [Kevin walks out the door into the kitchen]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Common mistake.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, it's not.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Points and Pete] Nerd! Do you know every line of the movie?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: My brother dared me to memorize it, and I did it, and loved doing it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay, let's hear it.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hear what?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Die hard. Every line. Go.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: "You don't like flying, do you?"

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Don't change the subject.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: No, that's the-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Movie is starting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [In Kitchen] We're thinking of collaborating with Mike Schmidt on some of his charity work.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I love Philly. Dirty town.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Comes up behind Jim and puts his hands on Jim's shoulders] Ah-Ha-Ha! Philly! Exciting stuff, man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So you sure you remembered everything for your trip?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I think so.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Think that through for a sec.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, Jim's going to philly tomorrow. He said he was gonna take me with him, but that was two months ago. And I haven't heard anything since. I mean, he said that, right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What else could you possibly be forgetting?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Things? People?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim chuckles nervously]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know who's not gonna get to work on some exciting new startup this year? George Howard Skub, a.k.a. the alleged Scranton strangler, because he's in prison [Jim and Daryl walk out of the kitchen] for something he may not have done.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I'm sorry, the-Uh, the Scranton who?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: The Scranton strangler. George Howard Skub. Haven't I told you about the jury I was on a couple years ago?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [Gasps] Oh, what happened? I mean, if you can talk about it, obviously. Because if you can't, I mean, I understand.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Stanley gets up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I-I could-I could talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [Pats Nellie on the shoulder as he's walking by her] See you next Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I could, sure. Have a seat. I would start at the beginning, but I think I need to go farther back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're the party planning committee, and we did not get where we are by playing it safe. We got here by being risk takers. And, yeah, Dwight's party is gonna be terrible. Maybe. Maybe it's not. Maybe it's going to be great. And if it's great...I think we all know what that would mean to us.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. I don't want my name attached to this party.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What does that even mean? Where would your name appear?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Please just take my name off of everything.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Just take her name off of everything.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Party Planning Committee walks out of The Conference Room]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Clears her throat] The party planning committee, minus Angela, has decided that we're all going to do Dwight's Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! Yeah! [High Fives Jim] Yeah! Okay! Yes! It's a Christmas Miracle! [High Fives Pam] Yeah! Whoo-Hoo!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, there is one rule that you need to take very seriously.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And that is...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That there are no rules.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have never been cooler.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Best Christmas ever.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Plays a trumpet] And Pennsylvania Dutch Christmas has officially begun.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ugh. What is this stuff, lava?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is gluhwein, otherwise known as glow-wine, also used to sterilize medical instruments. And, interesting factoid, this is the very spoon that guided my soft skull through the birth canal when I was born. Enjoy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What is it? [Jim lifts the hog maw with a fork] Don't touch it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Comes running up at startles Pam] Somebody's found the hog maw.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? It's a Pennsylvania Dutch specialty. Hog maw. That's a beauty, isn't it? I don't even want to tell you what it's made of until after you try it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Ugh. I'm not eating mystery meat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is stuffed pig stomach. And, after we finish it, we get to break the pig rib.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can't wait.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Weird. Where are the sugar cookies? Where's the karaoke machine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is austere, Meredith. This is celebrating Christmas for all of the right reasons. The cookies and toys and sweets are mere distractions. I mean, most people don't even know that a candy cane represents a Shepherd's Crook, which I assure you does not taste like peppermint. It tastes like sheep feces.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How would anyone even know-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have you ever tasted a Shepherd's Crook?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know. Is it what you expected?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel like [Pam look's out the window and camera pans out in The Office]-Dwight is holding a candle and reading a poem.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So happy right now.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim and Pam get up and run out into The Office]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Speaking German] Wait, what is that I hear? Is someone on the roof? How strange. [Blows out the candle] Excuse me. I have to run to my car to take a dump.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I wish my car had a bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: "Let Heinrich plant the detonators and Theo prepare the vault. After that-"

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [On a computer, checking the script] Eh. That wasn't the line. I'm sorry, Pete.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That is transcribed by some fan. They make mistakes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know. This looks pretty legit. [Erin's cell phone chimes] Oh, my gosh. I just got an email from Andy. That means they hit land.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Reading the email from Andy] "What up, shorty? We got in last night, sold the boat, went out, got drunk, saw life of pi, got super depressed and introspective. Gonna hang out here a while. Maybe a couple of weeks. Figure this whole life thing out. Maybe see hobbit. Lates."

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Erin walks back to Pete and sits down at the computer]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey. Everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So what comes next?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Right, um, okay. So he says, uh, [Pete stands up] "After we call the police, they'll waste hours trying to negotiate-"

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We should just watch the movie. That makes much more sense.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Or we can just sit and talk, though.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No. No more talking. It's movie time.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: I mean, are you sure...Um, yeah, I probably have a copy or two in my car.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, great. Great! So we're watching die hard, now. Good! This is a good plan.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [To Nellie in the kitchen] Here's the thing about moonlight. It's not sunlight.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [With his mouth full] I love this hog mama.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight said it's "Hog maw."

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Chokes and spits it out] What is maw?!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight walks in as Belsnickel]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's the lining of the stomach of-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Cackling] Ohh...[In a German Accent] Judgment is nigh, for the belsnickel ist I!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, he is finally nigh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am nigh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Every year, my grandfather would dress up as belsnickel at Christmas. He was...okay at it. I am great. You know how they say some people were born to be bad? Well, I was born to be belsnickel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ooh, belsnickel has traveled from distant lands to discover how all the boys and the girls have been behaving this last year. Whoo hoo HOO hoo hoo! [Runs over to Stanley and points at his stomach with a stick] Ohh...Too much strudel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So he's kind of like santa, except dirty and worse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, much better-No one fears santa the way they fear belsnickel.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! It's my favorite part of Christmas. The authority.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And the fear.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, exactly!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight, you're making this up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Reading from his phone] This is a real thing. "Belsnickel is a crotchety, fur-clad gift giver related to other companions of st. Nicholas in the folklore of southwestern Germany."

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, great. Seriously, you guys? Now you believe in Dwight's traditions, when some democrat looks it up on wikipedia?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Continues reading] "His partner, zwarte piet, or black Peter, a slave boy, often portrayed in colorful pantaloons and blackface."

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Uh-Uh. No, Dwight. No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, come on. We don't blindly stick to every outmoded aspect of our traditions. Come on, get with the spirit of it, you guys. [Texts warehouse worker, Nate, to forget showing up as zwarte piet]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Nate starts walking towards the door, gets the text, and walks back to his car]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pete and Erin watching die hard on a computer]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Okay, Karl was actually a ballet dancer in real life. Isn't that crazy?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Mm. [Chuckles]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Daryl drinking the gluhwein in his office, with some alcohol mixed in]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Talks drunk angry] Jim, that guy. [Scoffs] You gotta stick to your word! Like when you say something to a buddy, a real buddy...what are you gonna do, lie? To your buddy? [Sighs] It's awful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take a bowl and pass it down.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Thank you, Dwight. These are nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, these are gift bowls. When you recieve a gift, it will go in the bowl, but the bowls must be returned at the end. They're a set. Now, hold your bowls forward. The belsnickel will decide if you are impish or admirable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, it's like naughty or nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, impish or admirable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Quick question-Do you just decide who gets what in the moment, or did you make a list?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I decided earlier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, nice. Did you check that list?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of course I checked it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But more than once? 'cause you could have made a mistake.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I checked it more than once.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, so you made a list, you checked it twice, and now you're gonna find out who's-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Impish or admirable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Damn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phyllis Vance! Cheer or fear? Belsnickel is here! I judge your year as...admirable. [Jim claps] There you are.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [Takes here gift out of her bowl] Oh. What are these?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a set of rubber gaskets for canning jars.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'd rather have the bowl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can't have the bowl! Oscar Martinez, cheer or fear? Belsnickel is here! I judge your year [looks over at Angela, then back to Oscar]...as impish! [Smacks Oscar with a stick]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Angela smiles smugly]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ow! You hit people with that thing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I'm carrying around the stick in order to look cool. For the kinder [puts a mouse trap in Pam's bowl]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Holds the mouse trap up] Mouse trap.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [While Dwight is decided on others, he puts canning jars in Angela's bowl, and a twig in Stanley's, then a normal talking head]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In a head-to-head contest, people prefer belsnickel over santa every time. There aren't as many songs about him, but I attribute that more to rhyming difficulties. My brother and I wrote one once. it was about a fickle pickle salesman who would tickle you for a nickel.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Kevin giggles as Dwight is poking him with a stick for being impish]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, you know what? I gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop giggling.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, really? Already?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, it's all right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a punishment. [Turns to Jim] Hey, where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have to go to philly. But this was amazing. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But you work tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I know, I'd just like to settle in and get a good night's sleep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But we were gonna break the pig rib.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Remember?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No matter! Belsnickel cares not about this-off with you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perfect. Merry Christmas, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait! Don't you want to know your present?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? Yeah. Have at it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim Halpert. Cheer or fear? Belsnickel is here! [Jim holds his hands like a bowl] I judge your year as impish. [Hits Jim with stick]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh! Are you nuts?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Hits Jim three more times] I judge you impish!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ow! Ow! Okay, that is three, and you didn't hit anybody that hard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They're not abandoning the party. [Hit's Jim again]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just-Just-Hey!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight hits him again]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [As he's walking out] That's enough, I'm done! Okay? Agh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Hits Jim some more] Impish! [Chases Jim out]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aah! Ow!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Belsnickel, I gotta run out early too. [Leans up against the wall as Dwight comes back in]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Everyone groans. And in his office, Daryl continues to drink the gluhwein]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [In the parking lot, holding his side, walking to the taxi, Pam follows] Oh...what was that? Now I'm gonna be all whipped for my first day at work. God. [To taxi driver] One second. Oh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well...this is it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm probably never gonna see you again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shut up. I'm trying to be serious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, sorry, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't believe this is actually happening.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Listen, thank you so much for putting that all together. That was the perfect last Christmas party. All right, wish me luck.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. [Jim and Pam hug] Good luck. You're gonna be great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll call you when I get in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Love you.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim gets in taxi and it drives away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Party's over. You quit on Christmas, Christmas quits on you. [To camera] And guess what, kids. Belsnickel isn't real. It's me, Dwight! [Takes off hat and beard]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Everyone putting up normal Christmas decorations as Phyllis has a talking head]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We found some old decorations in the warehouse. Oscar ran to the store for some food and drink, and I dipped into my stash of eggnog. I guess they needed me after all. It's like in it's a wonderful life when Jimmy Stewart realizes that all thos people at the building and loan were just jerks, and he was the real hero.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Kevin dressed up as Santa, helps Angela down from hanging lights]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin. Kevin! Aaah. Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, it sounds like the party's starting up out there.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah. So anyway, the entire jury wants me to vote guilty. But then I did a little research of my own, and forget everything you thought you knew about fingerprinting.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Meredith's a little cute. I'm just realizing. She got, like, a Emma Stone thing.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Daryl comes out of the conference room and starts dancing. Meredith joins him]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [At Meredtith] Boo!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For what it's worth, I liked your party better.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everyone thought the food was gross, and that belsnickel was some darkly erotic freak.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think anyone thought that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim couldn't even stay till the end of the party.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, that didn't have anything to do with you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't care. Guess how much I care on a scale of one to ten.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Zero.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn It!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm gonna tell Jim to go [Bleep] himself.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you think Andy would ever jump off an exploding building tied to a hose for me?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah. Definitely. [Erin starts to cry] Hey, what's-Oh, no, come here. [Starts to put his arm around Erin] Hey, hey. Come on, huh?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Sliding away from Pete] I'm still Andy's girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, of course. I know.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But you can leave your arm.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pete puts his arm back around Erin as she slides closer to him]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Back at the party, Angela sits on Kevin's lap, everyone talking and enjoying the party]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, want me to get you some eggnog?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, thanks. I'll just have another dumatril. Jim taught me this really cool way to take it. You crush it into a powder, and you snort it up your butt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Walks back into The Office] Yep, I did say that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's going on? Where's the belsnickel?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh-Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam goes to hug Jim, but Dwight runs and hugs Jim first]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing? Last time I saw you, you were whipping me out of the building.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Holds his finger to Jim's lips] Shh. Let's not speak of that. The Pig Rib! We could totally break the pig rib! I'm gonna dig it out of the trash! [High fives Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What happened? Did you miss your bus?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. I just missed my wife.[Gives Pam a hug and a kiss]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Comes back in, holding up the pig rib] I found it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I found out that there's a bus at 5:00 a.m.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [All cheering and chanting as Jim and Dwight try and break the pig rib]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh! [Pig rib breaks and Jim wins, and stuff splatters people. Everyone groans] Damn It! Jim got the bigger half.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim fist bumps Kevin and holds up the pig rib. Daryl sits in his office]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [To himself] Back for more, huh? [Gets up and walks towards Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh, nog it. Let me get some nog. [Everyone talking Phyllis pours Jim some eggnog, as Daryl walks in] Thanks, Phyllis. Where's Andy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey, man. [Daryl walks over to Jim, angrily and stares at Jim] Oh, you know what? Before I forget again, I talked to the guys about hiring you. They're gonna bring you in for an interview.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Looking at Jim confused] That's great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, of course.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I shall come by at your convenience.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you, sir. [Tips his glass to Daryl]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Claps his hands once, spins around] Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Go get 'em.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Falls backwards onto the food table] Oh! Whoa!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Everyone shouts alarmidly]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very impish.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Nellie and Toby back in the kitchen, Nellie looks bored and standing against the fridge. Toby walking around]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Two dimes, seven nickels-Well, okay, no, that doesn't add up. It was one quarter and-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Shh. [Puts her finger to Toby's lips]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What? I was just explaining-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Why wouldn't it-

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [Put her finger to his lips again] Shh.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: But why?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No...more...talking.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Are you gonna kiss me?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes. [Kisses Toby]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Toby takes his glasses off and him and Nellie go against fridge and start to make out]
